column4: Anyone knows why VLC is consuming 20% CPU usage when I play .avi/.mpg/.wmv/.flv files in Ubuntu? In Windows 7 and Vista it is using the GPU accelerator to decode files -- is it possible to reduce the CPU usage in Ubuntu when playing .avi/.mpg/.flv files
use gnome-mplayer, its the daddy
do you mean Konsole or Terminal?
the terminal
I dont have any clickable delete button in terminal
when i hit the delete button on keyboard
ok then thats not clicking is it. You click with a mouse
if there is nothing to delete, the bell will sound
not in windows
what about windows?
do you mean cmd.exe?
no, not only in the terminal .. in web browsers, irc .. my computer is making a beep when i hit the delete button on my keyboard when theres nothing to delete
sounds reasonable to me, I always blacklist that pcspkr module, gets annoying
how can i blacklist pcspkr module?
gksudo gedit /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf
then add this line: blacklist pcspkr      save the file and close gedit then run: sudo rmmod pcspkr
will it always blacklist when i boot Ubuntu after i have done that?
yes thats what the config file change does
tried a different player?
no, i dont know any other players for Ubuntu?
sudo apt-get install gnome-mplayer
mplayer is using 29% CPU
